trans-unit.source: Authenticate your Windows Store app with Live Connect
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your Windows Store app with Live Connect

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Live Connect single sign-on in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Live Connect single sign-on in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to obtain an authentication token for Microsoft account using the Live SDK from a universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to obtain an authentication token for Microsoft account using the Live SDK from a universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: You then use this token to authenticate users with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: You then use this token to authenticate users with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add Microsoft account authentication to an existing project using the Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add Microsoft account authentication to an existing project using the Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: When successfully authenticated, a logged-in user is welcomed by name and the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When successfully authenticated, a logged-in user is welcomed by name and the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the benefits of using client-directed authentication and the Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the benefits of using client-directed authentication and the Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to more easily authenticate an already logged-on user with you mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to more easily authenticate an already logged-on user with you mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You can also request additional scopes to enable your app to also access resources like OneDrive.
trans-unit.target: You can also request additional scopes to enable your app to also access resources like OneDrive.

trans-unit.source: Service-directed authentication provides a more generalized experience and supports multiple authentication providers.
trans-unit.target: Service-directed authentication provides a more generalized experience and supports multiple authentication providers.

trans-unit.source: For more information about service-directed authentication, see the topic <linkText>Add authentication to your app</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about service-directed authentication, see the topic <linkText>Add authentication to your app</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: [Live SDK]
trans-unit.target: [Live SDK]

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Update 3, or a later version.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Update 3, or a later version.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete either <linkText>Get started with Mobile Services</linkText><title></title> or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete either <linkText>Get started with Mobile Services</linkText><title></title> or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.

trans-unit.source: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your app at the Microsoft account Developer Center.
trans-unit.target: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your app at the Microsoft account Developer Center.

trans-unit.source: You must then connect this registration with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You must then connect this registration with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Please complete the steps in the following topic to create a Microsoft account registration and connect it to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Please complete the steps in the following topic to create a Microsoft account registration and connect it to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register your app to use a Microsoft account login</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register your app to use a Microsoft account login</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You next need to restrict access to a resource, in this case the TodoItems table to make sure it can only be accessed by a signed-in user.
trans-unit.target: You next need to restrict access to a resource, in this case the TodoItems table to make sure it can only be accessed by a signed-in user.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you add the Live SDK and use it to authenticate users in your app.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you add the Live SDK and use it to authenticate users in your app.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, and then select Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, and then select Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the Online category, search for LiveSDK, click Install on the Live SDK package, select all projects, then accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the Online category, search for LiveSDK, click Install on the Live SDK package, select all projects, then accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: This adds the Live SDK to the solution.
trans-unit.target: This adds the Live SDK to the solution.

trans-unit.source: Open the shared project file MainPage.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared project file MainPage.xaml.cs and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:

trans-unit.source: This creates a member variable for storing the current Live Connect session and a method to handle the authentication process.
trans-unit.target: This creates a member variable for storing the current Live Connect session and a method to handle the authentication process.

trans-unit.source: You should try to use cached Live authentiction tokens or Mobile Services authorization tokens before requesting new tokens from the services.
trans-unit.target: You should try to use cached Live authentiction tokens or Mobile Services authorization tokens before requesting new tokens from the services.

trans-unit.source: If you don't do this, you might have usage-relates issues should many customers try to start your app at the same time.
trans-unit.target: If you don't do this, you might have usage-relates issues should many customers try to start your app at the same time.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to cache this token, see <linkText>Get started with authentication</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to cache this token, see <linkText>Get started with authentication</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Comment-out or delete the call to the RefreshTodoItems method in the existing OnNavigatedTo method override.
trans-unit.target: Comment-out or delete the call to the RefreshTodoItems method in the existing OnNavigatedTo method override.

trans-unit.source: This prevents the data from being loaded before the user is authenticated.
trans-unit.target: This prevents the data from being loaded before the user is authenticated.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will add a button to start the sign-in process.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will add a button to start the sign-in process.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code snippet to the MainPage class:

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Store app project, open the MainPage.xaml project file and add the following Button element just before the element that defines the Save button:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Store app project, open the MainPage.xaml project file and add the following Button element just before the element that defines the Save button:

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step for the Windows Phone Store app project, but this time add the Button in the TitlePanel, after the TextBlock element.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step for the Windows Phone Store app project, but this time add the Button in the TitlePanel, after the TextBlock element.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app and sign into Live Connect with your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app and sign into Live Connect with your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Windows Phone Store app project, click Set as StartUp Project, then repeat the previous step to verify that the Windows Phone Store app also runs correctly.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Windows Phone Store app project, click Set as StartUp Project, then repeat the previous step to verify that the Windows Phone Store app also runs correctly.

trans-unit.source: Now, any user authenticated by one of your registered identity providers can access the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Now, any user authenticated by one of your registered identity providers can access the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: To better secure user-specific data, you must also implement authorization.
trans-unit.target: To better secure user-specific data, you must also implement authorization.

trans-unit.source: To do this you get the user ID of a given user, which can then be used to determine what level of access that user should have for a given resource.
trans-unit.target: To do this you get the user ID of a given user, which can then be used to determine what level of access that user should have for a given resource.

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to use other identity providers for authentication, see [Get started with authentication].
trans-unit.target: For information about how to use other identity providers for authentication, see [Get started with authentication].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with .NET in [Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with .NET in [Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]
